definition: to issue (a memorandum etc) to lower levels/to distribute (e.g. disaster relief to victims)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: She unpinned her hair before going to bed.
The croupier dealt each player a card , face down.
sentences.chinese: 賭檯管理員給每位玩家正面朝下發了一張牌。

sentences.english: A document issued to sub-branches shall be sealed by all the issuers .
sentences.chinese: 聯合下發的公文，發文機關都應當加蓋印章。

sentences.english: No ephedrine shall be imported any more under any circumstances as of the date of issuance of this Circular.
sentences.chinese: 從本通知下發之日起，一律不再進口麻黃素。

sentences.english: The White House will staff out the recommendations before making a decision.
sentences.chinese: 白宮在做出決定之前，將會下發建議書。

sentences.english: So I've handed out an information sheet about it.
sentences.chinese: 我已經下發了一個包含考試信息的紙張。

sentences.english: All of these technical guidance documents were distributed to local authorities with the annual residue monitoring program together.
sentences.chinese: 上述技術指導性文件隨年度殘留監控計劃一併下發。
